CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Blog on Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre's Research Pages and Computer Arithmetic CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Blog on Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre's Research Pages and Computer Arithmetic http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html 2015-02-11T17:01:13+00:00 en daily 4 Our New Article On the Maximum Relative Error When Computing Integer Powers by Iterated Multiplications in Floating-Point Arithmetic http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00907 My new article On the maximum relative error when computing integer powers by iterated multiplications in floating-point arithmetic co-written with Stef Graillat and Jean-Michel Muller, which will be published in Numerical Algorithms, is available on: the editor's website (this is the official, final version, but not freely available if your library doesn't have the adequate subscription); HAL (almost identical to the final version, and freely available). Note: the version on arXiv is... 2015-02-11T17:01:13+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog en My new article On the maximum relative error when computing integer powers by iterated multiplications in floating-point arithmetic co-written with Stef Graillat and Jean-Michel Muller, which will be published in Numerical Algorithms, is available on:

  • the editor's website (this is the official, final version, but not freely available if your library doesn't have the adequate subscription);

  • HAL (almost identical to the final version, and freely available).

Note: the version on arXiv is currently an older one.

Abstract:

We improve the usual relative error bound for the computation of xn through iterated multiplications by x in binary floating-point arithmetic. The obtained error bound is only slightly better than the usual one, but it is simpler. We also discuss the more general problem of computing the product of n terms.

]]> Patch 11 for GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00899 Patch 11 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 is available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. It fixes a buffer overflow in mpfr_strtofr due to incorrect GMP documentation for mpn_set_str about the size of a buffer: announce and discussion \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd first fix in the GMP documentation. This bug is present in the MPFR versions from 2.1.0 (adding mpfr_strtofr) to 3.1.2. Various links: Debian: bug 772008. Red Hat: bug 1171701. Secunia Advisory SA61086. 2014-12-12T21:50:10+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en Patch 11 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 is available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. It fixes a buffer overflow in mpfr_strtofr due to incorrect GMP documentation for mpn_set_str about the size of a buffer: announce and discussion \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd first fix in the GMP documentation. This bug is present in the MPFR versions from 2.1.0 (adding mpfr_strtofr) to 3.1.2.

Various links:

  • Debian: bug 772008.

  • Red Hat: bug 1171701.

  • Secunia Advisory SA61086.

]]> ARITH-22 Call For Papers http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00890 Call for papers: 22nd IEEE Symposium on Computer Arithmetic (ARITH-22). Deadline for the abstract: October 26, 2014. Deadline for the full paper: November 2, 2014. Conference: June 22-24, 2015, in Lyon, France.

]]> Patches 9 and 10 for GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00877 Patches 9 and 10 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. They fix the following bugs. When a very large number (near the maximum finite one, in absolute value) is divided by a very small number (near the minimum one, in absolute value), an integer overflow occurs in the computation of the exponent of the result, yielding undefined behavior, such as the result 0 instead of infinity. The vasprintf.c source file contains incorrect assertions, which may fail... 2014-07-07T21:43:11+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en Patches 9 and 10 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. They fix the following bugs.

  • When a very large number (near the maximum finite one, in absolute value) is divided by a very small number (near the minimum one, in absolute value), an integer overflow occurs in the computation of the exponent of the result, yielding undefined behavior, such as the result 0 instead of infinity.

  • The vasprintf.c source file contains incorrect assertions, which may fail while the computation is valid; this can occur only when outputting tiny numbers (very small exponents).

]]> Patches 4 to 8 for GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00866 Patches 4 to 8 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page (patches 4 and 5 are from a few months ago, but patches 6 to 8 were added last night). The main bug is a possibly incorrect rounding with mpfr_exp, only when the precision is at least a few thousands bits (otherwise the buggy code isn't executed). The last patch fixes an internal compatibility problem with GMP\ufffd\ufffd6 (released two weeks ago) when MPFR is compiled with a particular option (generally not used). 2014-04-16T10:28:45+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en Patches 4 to 8 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page (patches 4 and 5 are from a few months ago, but patches 6 to 8 were added last night). The main bug is a possibly incorrect rounding with mpfr_exp, only when the precision is at least a few thousands bits (otherwise the buggy code isn't executed). The last patch fixes an internal compatibility problem with GMP\ufffd\ufffd6 (released two weeks ago) when MPFR is compiled with a particular option (generally not used).

]]> Research Pages: Incorrect Formulas in my Slides on GNU MPFR http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00861 I've just found an error in both formulas on my slide Simple Output about GNU MPFR (there's also an English typo). Three presentations are affected. I have not modified the slides, but I've added errata in the section about my slides. Note: The GNU MPFR library (code and documentation) was correct. 2014-03-17T17:59:50+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR en I've just found an error in both formulas on my slide Simple Output about GNU MPFR (there's also an English typo). Three presentations are affected. I have not modified the slides, but I've added errata in the section about my slides.

Note: The GNU MPFR library (code and documentation) was correct.

]]> La Recherche Award 2013 http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00844 I and colleagues received the La Recherche award 2013 in the Computer science category, for our article: Peter Kornerup, Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre [Inria], Nicolas Louvet [Universit\ufffd\ufffd Lyon 1], and Jean-Michel Muller [CNRS]. On the computation of correctly-rounded sums. IEEE Transactions on Computers, 61(3):289\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd298, March 2012. The awards ceremony took place on Tuesday 22 October 2013 at the mus\ufffd\ufffde du quai Branly in Paris. The videos, in French, are now available on the official web site. Links (in... 2013-11-13T00:48:51+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog en I and colleagues received the La Recherche award 2013 in the Computer science category, for our article: Peter Kornerup, Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre [Inria], Nicolas Louvet [Universit\ufffd\ufffd Lyon 1], and Jean-Michel Muller [CNRS]. On the computation of correctly-rounded sums. IEEE Transactions on Computers, 61(3):289\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd298, March 2012.

The awards ceremony took place on Tuesday 22 October 2013 at the mus\ufffd\ufffde du quai Branly in Paris. The videos, in French, are now available on the official web site.

Links (in French):

  • Winners 2013.

  • Photos of the ceremony.

  • Video for our category.

  • News on the ENS de Lyon web site.

]]> Patches 1 to 3 for GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00839 Patches 1 to 3 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. The main bug that has been fixed concerns the unsigned mpfr_fits_u*_p class of functions: these functions were returning 0 (doesn't fit) instead of non-zero (fits) on negative arguments for which the rounding to an integer in the given rounding mode is 0 (thus a representable rounded value). 2013-10-10T10:15:51+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en Patches 1 to 3 of GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 are available in the bugs section of the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 page. The main bug that has been fixed concerns the unsigned mpfr_fits_u*_p class of functions: these functions were returning 0 (doesn't fit) instead of non-zero (fits) on negative arguments for which the rounding to an integer in the given rounding mode is 0 (thus a representable rounded value).

]]> Sipe Mini-Library http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00836 I've updated my Sipe mini-library: I've completed the floating-point based implementation and added support for rounding toward zero in the integer based implementation. 2013-09-22T23:48:55+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en I've updated my Sipe mini-library: I've completed the floating-point based implementation and added support for rounding toward zero in the integer based implementation.

]]> Sipe Mini-Library and ARITH-21 Conference http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00815 On the occasion of the ARITH-21 conference in Austin, Texas, USA, where I presented my Sipe mini-library (previously SIPE) last month, I've created a new web page dedicated to Sipe, which I've just updated. I now provide examples and links to my publications and to my presentation at ARITH-21. 2013-05-05T00:45:28+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en On the occasion of the ARITH-21 conference in Austin, Texas, USA, where I presented my Sipe mini-library (previously SIPE) last month, I've created a new web page dedicated to Sipe, which I've just updated. I now provide examples and links to my publications and to my presentation at ARITH-21.

]]> GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 is Released http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00806 The GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 library (canard \ufffd\ufffd l'orange, patch level 2) has been released. The changes from version 3.1.1: bug fixes (detailed list on the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.1 page) and updated examples to the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.x API. Note: The official tarballs for MPFR up to 3.1.1 are affected by a GNU Automake bug introducing a vulnerability in make distcheck. One of the purposes of this new release is to provide tarballs without this vulnerability. 2013-03-13T23:57:31+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Security en The GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 library (canard \ufffd\ufffd l'orange, patch level 2) has been released. The changes from version 3.1.1: bug fixes (detailed list on the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.1 page) and updated examples to the MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.x API.

Note: The official tarballs for MPFR up to 3.1.1 are affected by a GNU Automake bug introducing a vulnerability in make distcheck. One of the purposes of this new release is to provide tarballs without this vulnerability.

]]> GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 Release Candidate http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00804 GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 Release Candidate is available (bug fixes). 2013-03-09T00:29:51+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Software en GNU MPFR\ufffd\ufffd3.1.2 Release Candidate is available (bug fixes).

]]> mpfr.org Server Scheduled Downtime and Security Announcement http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00800 We have received an announce saying that due to technical maintenance, the computer systems at the Loria will be stopped from Friday, February\ufffd\ufffd8, 2013 at 17:30 CET [16:30 UTC] to Saturday, February\ufffd\ufffd9, 2013 at 18:00 CET [17:00 UTC] (except unpredictable incident). Only the mpfr.org web server will be affected by this downtime (and mail sent to the old @loria.fr address of the MPFR mailing-list). Sorry for the inconvenience. Moreover, all the MPFR tarballs are affected by a GNU Automake bug... 2013-02-08T01:26:17+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Security \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Unix/Linux en We have received an announce saying that due to technical maintenance, the computer systems at the Loria will be stopped from Friday, February\ufffd\ufffd8, 2013 at 17:30 CET [16:30 UTC] to Saturday, February\ufffd\ufffd9, 2013 at 18:00 CET [17:00 UTC] (except unpredictable incident). Only the mpfr.org web server will be affected by this downtime (and mail sent to the old @loria.fr address of the MPFR mailing-list). Sorry for the inconvenience.

Moreover, all the MPFR tarballs are affected by a GNU Automake bug introducing a vulnerability in make distcheck; users of this command should read the details here.

]]> \ufffd\ufffdcole Pr\ufffd\ufffdcision et Reproductibilit\ufffd\ufffd en Calcul Num\ufffd\ufffdrique http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00798 Une \ufffd\ufffdcole th\ufffd\ufffdmatique \ufffd\ufffd laquelle je vais intervenir (session sur l'arithm\ufffd\ufffdtique flottante en pr\ufffd\ufffdcision arbitraire, et plus particuli\ufffd\ufffdrement sur GNU MPFR): \ufffd\ufffdcole Pr\ufffd\ufffdcision et Reproductibilit\ufffd\ufffd en Calcul Num\ufffd\ufffdrique, Fr\ufffd\ufffdjus (centre CAES du CNRS), 25-29 mars 2013. Date limite d'inscription: 15 f\ufffd\ufffdvrier 2013. 2013-01-30T23:15:48+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre CariBlog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MPFR fr Une \ufffd\ufffdcole th\ufffd\ufffdmatique \ufffd\ufffd laquelle je vais intervenir (session sur l'arithm\ufffd\ufffdtique flottante en pr\ufffd\ufffdcision arbitraire, et plus particuli\ufffd\ufffdrement sur GNU MPFR): \ufffd\ufffdcole Pr\ufffd\ufffdcision et Reproductibilit\ufffd\ufffd en Calcul Num\ufffd\ufffdrique, Fr\ufffd\ufffdjus (centre CAES du CNRS), 25-29 mars 2013.

Date limite d'inscription: 15 f\ufffd\ufffdvrier 2013.

]]> vinc17.net Now Available via https http://www.vinc17.org/research/blog/index.en.html#b00790 For a couple of days, it has now been possible to connect to vinc17.net and www.vinc17.net via https, e.g. https://vinc17.net/ or equivalently https://www.vinc17.net/. Note that the certificate is valid only for these two names, so that the connection is completely secure only for these two URL prefixes, not for URL's with vinc17.org (I just don't want to pay for a service that would be identical). 2012-12-14T01:35:23+00:00 Vincent Lef\ufffd\ufffdvre Announce \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Blog \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd vinc17 en For a couple of days, it has now been possible to connect to vinc17.net and www.vinc17.net via https, e.g. https://vinc17.net/ or equivalently https://www.vinc17.net/. Note that the certificate is valid only for these two names, so that the connection is completely secure only for these two URL prefixes, not for URL's with vinc17.org (I just don't want to pay for a service that would be identical).

]]>
